text: From: Paul, an apostle of the Messiah Jesus by the will of God, and Timothy our brother.
speaker: Narrator

text:
To: The holy and faithful brothers in Colossae who are in union with the Messiah.
May grace and peace from God our Father be yours!
speaker: Narrator

text: We give thanks to God, the Father of our Lord Jesus, the Messiah, praying always for you,
speaker: Narrator

text: because we have heard about your faith in the Messiah Jesus and the love that you have for all the saints,
speaker: Narrator

text: based on the hope laid up for you in heaven. Some time ago you heard about this hope through the word of truth, the gospel
speaker: Narrator

text: that has come to you. Just as it is bearing fruit and spreading all over the world, so it has been doing among you from the day you heard it and came to know the grace of God in truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: You learned about this gospel from Epaphras, our dear fellow servant, who is a faithful minister of the Messiah on your behalf.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has told us about your love in the Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason, since the day we heard about this, we have not stopped praying for you and asking that you may be filled with the full knowledge of God’s will with respect to all spiritual wisdom and understanding,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that you might live in a manner worthy of the Lord and be fully pleasing to him as you bear fruit while doing all kinds of good things and growing in the full knowledge of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are being strengthened with all power according to his glorious might, so that you might patiently endure everything with joy
speaker: Narrator

text: and might thank the Father, who has enabled us to share in the saints’ inheritance in the light.
speaker: Narrator

text: God has rescued us from the power of darkness and has brought us into the kingdom of the Son whom he loves,
speaker: Narrator

text: through whom we have redemption, the forgiveness of sins.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Son is the image of the invisible God,
    the firstborn over all creation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For by him all things in heaven and on earth were created,
    things visible and invisible,
        whether they are kings, lords, rulers, or powers.
All things have been created through him and for him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He himself existed before anything else did,
    and he holds all things together.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is also the head of the body,
    which is the church.
He is the beginning, the firstborn from the dead,
    so that he himself might have first place in everything.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For God was pleased to have
    all of his divine essence inhabit him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Through the Son, God also reconciled all things to himself,
    whether things on earth or things in heaven,
thereby making peace
    through the blood of his cross.
speaker: Narrator

text: You who were once alienated with a hostile attitude, doing evil,
speaker: Narrator

text: he has now reconciled by the death of his physical body, so that he may present you holy, blameless, and without fault before him.
speaker: Narrator

text: However, you must remain firmly established and steadfast in the faith, without being moved from the hope of the gospel that you heard, which has been proclaimed to every creature under heaven and of which I, Paul, have become a servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I am rejoicing while suffering for you as I complete in my flesh whatever remains of the Messiah’s sufferings on behalf of his body, which is the church.
speaker: Narrator

text: I became its servant as God commissioned me to work for you, so that I may complete my ministry of the word of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: This secret was hidden throughout the ages and generations but has now been revealed to his saints,
speaker: Narrator

text: to whom God wanted to make known the glorious riches of this secret among the gentiles—which is the Messiah in you, our glorious hope.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is he whom we proclaim as we admonish and wisely teach everyone, so that we may present everyone mature in the Messiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: I work hard and struggle to do this, using the energy that he powerfully provides in me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I want you to know how much I struggle for you, for those in Laodicea, and for all who have never seen me face to face.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because they are united in love, I pray that their hearts may be encouraged by all the riches that come from a complete understanding of the full knowledge of the Messiah, who is the mystery of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: In him are stored all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: I say this so that no one will mislead you with nice-sounding rhetoric.
speaker: Narrator

text: For although I am physically absent, I am with you in spirit, rejoicing to see how stable you are and how firm your faith in the Messiah is.
speaker: Narrator

text: So then, just as you have received the Messiah Jesus the Lord, continue to live dependent on him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you have been rooted in him and are being built up and strengthened in the faith, just as you were taught, while you continue to be thankful.
speaker: Narrator

text: See to it that no one enslaves you through philosophy and empty deceit according to human tradition, according to the basic principles of the world, and not according to the Messiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: because all the essence of deity inhabits him in bodily form.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you have been filled by him, who is the head of every ruler and authority.
speaker: Narrator

text: In union with him you were also circumcised with a circumcision performed without human hands by stripping off the corrupt nature by the circumcision performed by the Messiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you were buried with the Messiah in baptism, you were also raised with him through faith in the power of God, who raised him from the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even when you were dead because of your offenses and the uncircumcision of your flesh, God made you alive with him when he forgave us all of our offenses,
speaker: Narrator

text: having erased the charges that were brought against us, along with their obligations that were hostile to us. He took those charges away when he nailed them to the cross.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he had disarmed the rulers and the authorities, he made a public spectacle of them, triumphing over them in the cross.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, let no one judge you in matters of food and drink or with respect to a festival, a New Moon, or Sabbath days.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are a shadow of the things to come, but the reality belongs to the Messiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let no one who delights in humility and the worship of angels cheat you out of the prize by rejoicing about what he has seen. Such a person is puffed up for no reason by his carnal mind.
speaker: Narrator

text: He does not hold on to the head, from whom the whole body, which is nourished and held together by its joints and ligaments, grows as God enables it.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you have died with the Messiah to the basic principles of the world, why are you submitting to its decrees as though you still lived in the world?
speaker: Narrator

text: “Don’t handle this! Don’t taste or touch that!”
speaker: Narrator

text: All of these things will be destroyed as they are used, because they are based on human commands and teachings.
speaker: Narrator

text: These things have the appearance of wisdom in promoting self-made religion, humility, and harsh treatment of the body, but they have no value against self-indulgence.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, if you have been raised with the Messiah, keep focusing on the things that are above, where the Messiah is seated at the right hand of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep your minds on things that are above, not on things that are on the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you have died, and your life has been safely guarded by the Messiah in God.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Messiah, who is your life, is revealed, then you, too, will be revealed with him in glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: So put to death your worldly impulses: sexual sin, impurity, passion, evil desire, and greed (which is idolatry).
speaker: Narrator

text: It is because of these things that the wrath of God is coming on those who are disobedient.
speaker: Narrator

text: You used to behave like them as you lived among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now you must also get rid of anger, wrath, malice, slander, obscene speech, and all such sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not lie to one another, for you have stripped off the old nature with its practices
speaker: Narrator

text: and have clothed yourselves with the new nature, which is being renewed in full knowledge, consistent with the image of the one who created it.
speaker: Narrator

text: In him there is no Greek or Jew, circumcised or uncircumcised, barbarian, Scythian, slave, or free person. Instead, the Messiah is all and in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, as God’s chosen ones, holy and loved, clothe yourselves with compassion, kindness, humility, meekness, and patience.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be tolerant of one another and forgive each other if anyone has a complaint against another. Just as the Lord has forgiven you, you also should forgive.
speaker: Narrator

text: Above all, clothe yourselves with love, which ties everything together in unity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the peace of the Messiah also rule in your hearts, to which you were called in one body, and be thankful.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the word of the Messiah inhabit you richly with wisdom, teaching and admonishing one another with psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs, and singing to God with thankfulness in your hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text: And whatever you do, whether by speech or action, do everything in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wives, submit yourselves to your husbands, as is appropriate for those who belong to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Husbands, love your wives, and do not be harsh with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Children, obey your parents in everything, for this is pleasing to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fathers, do not make your children resentful. Otherwise, they’ll become discouraged.
speaker: Narrator

text: Slaves, obey your earthly masters in everything, not only while being watched in order to please them, but with a sincere heart, fearing the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whatever you do, work at it wholeheartedly as though you were doing it for the Lord and not merely for people.
speaker: Narrator

text: You know that it is from the Lord that you will receive the inheritance as a reward. It is the Lord Messiah whom you are serving!
speaker: Narrator

text: For the person who does what is wrong will be paid back for what he has done without favoritism.
speaker: Narrator

text: Masters, treat your slaves justly and fairly, because you know that you also have a Master in heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Devote yourselves to prayer. Be alert and thankful when you pray.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the same time also pray for us—that God would open before us a door for the word so that we may tell the secret about the Messiah, for which I have been imprisoned.
speaker: Narrator

text: May I reveal it as clearly as I should!
speaker: Narrator

text: Behave wisely toward outsiders, making the best use of your time.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let your speech always be gracious, seasoned with salt, so that you may know how you ought to answer everyone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tychicus will tell you everything that has happened to me. He is a dear brother, a faithful minister, and a fellow servant in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am sending him to you for this very reason, so that you may know how we are doing and that he may encourage your hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is coming with Onesimus, that faithful and dear brother, who is one of you. They will tell you everything that is happening here.
speaker: Narrator

text: Aristarchus, my fellow prisoner, sends his greetings, as does Mark, the cousin of Barnabas. You have received instructions about him. If he comes to you, welcome him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus, who is called Justus, also greets you. These are the only ones of the circumcision who are fellow workers for the kingdom of God. They have been an encouragement to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Epaphras, who is one of you, a servant of the Messiah Jesus, sends you his greetings. He is always wrestling in his prayers for you, so that you may stand mature, completely convinced of the entire will of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I can testify on his behalf that he has a deep concern for you and for those in Laodicea and in Hierapolis.
speaker: Narrator

text: Luke, the beloved physician, and Demas greet you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give my greetings to the brothers in Laodicea, especially to Nympha and the church that is in her house.
speaker: Narrator

text: When this letter has been read among you, have it read also in the church of the Laodiceans, and be sure to read the one from Laodicea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tell Archippus, “See that you complete the ministry you have received from the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: This greeting is written with my own signature—“Paul.” Remember that I remain imprisoned. May grace be with you! Amen.
speaker: Narrator
